metas.name: StoryBots: Ask the StoryBots
metas.description: Similar to Ada Twist, Scientist and The Magic School Bus, this show uses animation and catchy songs to answer kids' burning questions about the world, making learning fun and engaging.

metas.name: Wild Kratts
metas.description: For fans of The Magic School Bus and WordGirl, Wild Kratts combines animation with live-action segments to explore animal science and habitats, encouraging curiosity about nature.

metas.name: Sid the Science Kid
metas.description: Echoes the educational spirit of Ada Twist, Scientist and The Magic School Bus, Sid the Science Kid encourages preschoolers to explore scientific concepts through observation and experimentation.

metas.name: Sesame Street
metas.description: A classic educational show like Numberblocks and Peg + Cat, Sesame Street teaches foundational literacy and numeracy skills through songs, sketches, and beloved characters.

metas.name: Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood
metas.description: This gentle animated series, like Doc McStuffins and Bluey, focuses on social-emotional learning, teaching young children valuable lessons about feelings and interactions.

metas.name: Dinosaur Train
metas.description: Combines the adventure of The Magic School Bus with a love for animals like Clifford the Big Red Dog, this show takes kids on a journey through prehistory to learn about dinosaurs and paleontology.

metas.name: Octonauts
metas.description: Similar to Special Agent Oso in its problem-solving aspect and the educational nature of Doc McStuffins, Octonauts follows a team of underwater explorers who rescue sea creatures.

metas.name: Puffin Rock
metas.description: This beautifully animated series, much like Bluey and Curious George, offers gentle stories about nature and sibling relationships, perfect for young viewers.

metas.name: Tumble Leaf
metas.description: With a focus on exploration and discovery akin to Curious George, Tumble Leaf follows a friendly caterpillar named Fig as he learns about the world around him through imaginative play.

metas.name: Sarah & Duck
metas.description: This charming stop-motion animated series, like Bluey and Puffin Rock, explores everyday wonders with a gentle pace and focuses on imagination and friendship.

metas.name: Super Why!
metas.description: Similar to WordGirl in its focus on literacy, Super Why! uses fairy tales to teach reading skills and problem-solving to preschoolers.

metas.name: The Cat in the Hat Knows a Lot About That!
metas.description: This educational series, akin to The Magic School Bus and Ada Twist, Scientist, uses the iconic Dr. Seuss character to explore various scientific topics in a fun and accessible way.

metas.name: Ready Jet Go!
metas.description: Aimed at sparking an interest in space and science, like The Magic School Bus and Ada Twist, Scientist, this show follows a group of kids who dream of exploring the cosmos.

metas.name: Go, Diego, Go!
metas.description: Building on the animal themes of Clifford the Big Red Dog and Doc McStuffins, this interactive show encourages kids to learn about animals and their habitats while on rescue missions.

metas.name: Molly of Denali
metas.description: This animated series, similar to Bluey in its focus on everyday life and problem-solving, introduces children to the culture and traditions of Alaska while promoting literacy.

metas.name: Hilda
metas.description: While having fantastical elements like The Magic School Bus, Hilda is a charming adventure series about a brave girl and her magical creature friends, with themes of friendship and exploration.

metas.name: Creative Galaxy
metas.description: This show encourages creative expression and art, much like the problem-solving aspects of Special Agent Oso and the imaginative play of Curious George.

metas.name: Xavier Riddle and the Secret Museum
metas.description: Similar to The Magic School Bus in its exploration of history and science, this show takes children on adventures to meet historical figures and learn about their contributions.

metas.name: The Great Indoors
metas.description: This series uses animation to explore various topics about the natural world, appealing to the curiosity sparked by The Magic School Bus and Curious George.

metas.name: True and the Rainbow Kingdom
metas.description: This visually appealing animated series, like Bluey and Doc McStuffins, focuses on problem-solving and friendship in a vibrant magical world.

metas.name: Costume Quest
metas.description: While having some adventure, this animated series is lighthearted and focuses on friendship and imagination, similar to the spirit of WordGirl and Bluey.

metas.name: Big Blue
metas.description: This animated series follows a family of explorers on aquatic adventures, offering a similar sense of discovery as The Magic School Bus and Curious George.

metas.name: Lily's Driftwood Bay
metas.description: This stop-motion animated series, like Puffin Rock and Sarah & Duck, tells gentle stories about friendship and nature with a charming aesthetic.

metas.name: Rhyme Time Town
metas.description: This musical series, similar to Peg + Cat and Numberblocks, uses songs and rhyme to teach early literacy and problem-solving skills.

metas.name: Grizzy & the Lemmings
metas.description: A lighthearted animated comedy with slapstick humor, similar to the fun and silliness found in Bluey and Clifford the Big Red Dog.

metas.name: Elinor Wonders Why
metas.description: This show encourages observation and curiosity about the natural world, making it a good companion to shows like Curious George and The Magic School Bus.

metas.name: The Fixies
metas.description: This animated series explains how everyday objects work, appealing to the scientific curiosity of Ada Twist, Scientist and The Magic School Bus.

metas.name: The Ollie & Moon Show
metas.description: This series takes children on adventures around the world, fostering curiosity and cultural awareness, similar to the exploratory nature of Curious George.

metas.name: Pocoyo
metas.description: A simple yet engaging animated series that focuses on basic concepts and gentle exploration, suitable for the youngest viewers, much like the early lessons in Peg + Cat.

metas.name: Hey Duggee
metas.description: This preschool series is fun and educational, with a focus on teamwork and earning badges, akin to the learning aspects of Doc McStuffins and Numberblocks.

metas.name: Alma's Way
metas.description: This series celebrates the Bronx and Puerto Rican culture, promoting problem-solving and community values, similar to the family focus of Bluey and Doc McStuffins.

metas.name: Chuggington
metas.description: This animated series about a group of trainee trains teaches valuable lessons about teamwork, friendship, and problem-solving, appealing to a similar audience as Clifford the Big Red Dog.
